title: How do you teach empathy? - Jonathan Juravich

multiple-choice.question: What is one thing that can be a barrier to understanding empathy in children?

options.text: Their ability to understand complex vocabulary

options.label: B
options.text: Their lack of experience with different cultures

options.label: C
options.text: Their inability to put themselves in someone else's shoes

options.label: D
options.text: Their tendency to focus on their own feelings

options.text: Empathy is a natural instinct that some people have

options.label: B
options.text: Empathy is a learned behavior that can be developed

options.label: C
options.text: Awareness: "a noticing of what is happening in and around you so that you can make a choice"

options.label: D

options.label: C
options.text: "I was sad because I didn't get to eat my favorite food."

options.label: D
options.text: "I was sad because I fell down and hurt myself."

options.label: D

options.label: C

title: A day in the life of a Peruvian shaman - Gabriel Prieto

multiple-choice.question: In the year 1400 BCE, Quexo's village is experiencing a series of troubling signs, including the lack of wind. What is the significance of the lack of wind in this context?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a sign of the approaching storms.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a sign of the abundance of fish in the sea.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a sign of the end of the fishing season.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a sign of the village's prosperity.

multiple-choice.question: Quexo, the village shaman, needs to perform a special ritual to stop the bad weather. What is the purpose of this ritual?

options.label: A
options.text: To bring good fortune to the village.

options.label: B
options.text: To ward off the storms and bring back the fish.

options.label: C
options.text: To celebrate the beginning of the season of abundance.

options.label: D
options.text: To punish the villagers for their wrongdoing.

multiple-choice.question: Quexo's role as a shaman allows him to do what?

options.label: B
options.text: Participate in the rituals and ceremonies.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the hematite that Quexo gathered from the sacred mountain?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a mineral used to make tools.

options.label: B
options.text: It is a mineral used to make jewelry.

options.label: C
options.text: It is a mineral used in the ritual to ward off the storms.

options.label: D
options.text: It is a mineral used to make ceremonial garb garb.

multiple-choice.question: Why does Quexo refuse the sacred cactus drink and instead sets off toward the mountains?

options.label: A
options.text: He is afraid of the highland shamans.

options.label: C
options.text: He needs to find the highland shamans to get the cinnabar.

options.label: D
options.text: He wants to attend the ceremonies in the main temple.

options.label: C
options.text: The vowel is protected from the monster.

title: The world's ugliest animal

multiple-choice.question: Where does the blobfish live?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: In the ocean off the coast of Australia

options.label: C
options.text: In the ocean off the coast of Asia

options.label: D
options.text: In the ocean off the coast of Africa

multiple-choice.question: Why does the blobfish look so "ugly"?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it has a lot of muscles and bones

options.label: B
options.text: Because it has a gooey, jelly-like body that can handle intense pressure

options.label: C
options.text: Because it has a beautiful, shiny scales

options.label: D
options.text: Because it has a long, pointed snout

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: How do ventilators work? - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: Who is credited with describing the first mechanical ventilation procedure in the 16th century?
What is the primary function of the alveoli in the lungs?

options.label: A
options.text: To filter oxygen from the air

options.label: B
options.text: To absorb oxygen from the inflated alveoli and leave behind carbon dioxide

multiple-choice.question: What is the main difference between positive pressure ventilation and negative pressure ventilation?

options.label: A
options.text: Positive pressure ventilation uses a facemask, while negative pressure ventilation uses a tube in the trachea

options.label: B
options.text: Positive pressure ventilation pumps air into the patient's lungs, while negative pressure ventilation allows air to be passively drawn in

options.label: C
options.text: Positive pressure ventilation is used for milder cases, while negative pressure ventilation is used for more severe cases

options.label: D
options.text: Positive pressure ventilation is used for non-invasive treatment, while negative pressure ventilation is used for invasive treatment

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary limitation of modern ventilators?

options.label: A
options.text: They are too expensive and require extensive training to operate

options.label: B
options.text: They are too bulky and require a lot of space

options.label: C
options.text: They are only effective for milder cases

options.label: D
options.text: They can cause long-term lung damage

multiple-choice.question: Why is there a need for more low-cost and portable ventilators?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are only used for milder cases

options.label: B
options.text: Because they are too expensive and require extensive training to operate

options.label: C
options.text: Because most hospitals only have a few in supply and need to stretch their limited cache during emergencies

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are only used for non-invasive treatment

title: Why can't dogs eat chocolate?

multiple-choice.question: What molecule found in chocolate is toxic to dogs?

options.text: Because humans eat more plants than pets do

options.label: B
options.text: Because humans are bigger than pets

options.label: C
options.text: Because humans have a different metabolism than pets

options.label: D
options.text: Because humans have a special enzyme to break down theobromine

multiple-choice.question: How much chocolate would a medium-sized dog need to eat to get a lethal dose of theobromine?

multiple-choice.question: Why are cats less likely to get poisoned from chocolate?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Because they can't taste sweet things

options.label: C
options.text: Because they have a special enzyme to break down theobromine

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are more interested in chocolate

multiple-choice.question: How much milk chocolate would a human need to eat to get a lethal dose of theobromine?
